text: Hi I am running Julia on widows 10 and I am trying to add SVR package but it's giving me these errors any solution for this?

text: If you have git installed, open git bash, and then open Julia within git bash. That should do the trick.

elements.text: If you have git installed, open git bash, and then open Julia within git bash. That should do the trick.

attachments.title: Using Julia on Git bash
attachments.text: I find windows powershell pretty buggy, and sometimes it breaks when trying to open Vim and the key press - display loop gets messed up. Git bash has always worked for me when ssh-ing. Is there a step by step guide to making it so that when I click the “Julia” icon in my start menu, it opens up Git bash instead of powershell? Thank you
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Using Julia on Git bash

text: Windows default shell is quite a pain. You can check out <https://github.com/heetbeet/juliawin> if you want. I've added an option to wrap Git bash as the default shell in Julia. Unfortunately it suffers from the following v1.5.3 bug <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/getting-julia-repl-working-in-windows-git-bash/50715> , so choose your poison

attachments.title: Getting Julia REPL working in Windows git/bash
attachments.text: I know one of the common Julia workflows in Windows is to run Julia through MinGW’s bash (popularly available with git): I’m working on a Windows distribution of Julia <https://github.com/heetbeet/juliawin> and was wondering if wrapping julia processes through MinGW should be one of the options, or maybe even the default option considering how posix focused the community is. But after my first few tests on running this pipeline, I found that the julia REPL gets jammed after calling run(ls) ...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Getting Julia REPL working in Windows git/bash

elements.text: Windows default shell is quite a pain. You can check out
if you want. I've added an option to wrap Git bash as the default shell in Julia. Unfortunately it suffers from the following v1.5.3 bug

text: So I would suggest to rather try it out in two weeks time or so when v1.6 is rolled out and default.

elements.text: So I would suggest to rather try it out in two weeks time or so when v1.6 is rolled out and default.

text: Looks like <https://github.com/madsjulia/SVR.jl> assumes that user is compiling the libsvm library.  Usually on Windows there is no compiler installed out-of-the-box.  libsvm is build exists in Yggdrasil <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/blob/master/L/libsvm/build_tarballs.jl>, and is installable `]add libsvm_jll`.  Update of SVR to use libsvm_jll would likely be easiest.
